description.narrative:
Core support to Civil Society Organisation GenderDoc-M (GDM). GDM is the only LGBT+ organisation in the Republic of Moldova. The support aims to strengthen the organization and contribute to their activities. The core support activities includes the four programs run by GDM.
- The LGBT Rights Lobby and Advocacy Program - The LGBT Community Development Program - The LGBT Health Program - GDM organizational Capacity Building Program
The mission of the organisation is: Creation of a favourable, legal and social Environment within the society for the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people by means of developing the LGBT Community, awareness raising, advocating to rights, providing services and building organisation's capacity.

Kärnstöd till den Moldaviska civilsamhällesorganisationen Gender-Doc-M. GDM är Moldaviens enda HBTQ+-organisation. Stödet syftar till att stärka organisationen och bidra till deras verksamhet genom flexibel finansiering som kan användas för både projekt och löpande kostnader för verksamheten. Kärnstödeverksamheten innefattar utvecklande och stärkande av GDM's fyra program:
- The LGBT Rights Lobby and Advocacy Program - The LGBT Community Development Program - The LGBT Health Program - GDM organizational Capacity Building Program
Organisationens syfte är: Skapandet av en bättre juridisk och social miljö i samhället för lesbiska, homosexuella, bisexuella och transpersoner genom utvecklandet av HBTQ+gemenskap, medvetandegörande, rättighetsarbete, erbjudandet av tjänster och kapacitetsutveckling.

The development intervention provides core support to GenderDoc-M, a Moldovan LGBT+ organisation. The intervention provides GDM with flexible core support in order to allow the organisation to focus on its core operations. The funds are used both for expendebles, staff and office costs etc. as well as projects and project related costs. The purpose is to strengthen GDM as an organisation making it even better equipped to work with LGBT issues and rights in Moldova. The indended outcome is that GenderDoc-M will be further strenghtened and capacitated to continue its work with rights for LGBT+ persons in Moldova and regionally.

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Since March 16, 2020, due to the declared state of emergency, all employees of the organization switched to remote work, and all events were online. The Health program continued to test and provide services from the organization’s office, while in other programs some activities were also off-line with all safety measures, however many activities had to be cancelled. The organization continued to work to reduce the level of homophobia, carried outinformation campaigns, trainings and created conditions to increase the visibility ofLGBT+ people. In total, there were three information campaigns and a series of nineinformational lives. In addition, there were interviews and participation in programs on the topic of LGBT. In 2020, six reports on the rights of LGBT people were compiled, reports were sent to interested organizations and representatives of various institutions. Throughout the year, media monitoring was carried out. Due to the pandemic, Pride March had to be canceled and most of the planned events of the Moldova Pride Festival were held online. The number of psychological consultations increased by 25%: 508 consultations wereheld in 2020, compared to 396 in 2019, which is probably due to the impact of thepandemic. COVID 19 also provided an opportunity to develop online services and reorganizeoutreach work so as not to leave beneficiaries behind the organization.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
